links.title: Download Full Investor Presentation
links.content:
(Nasdaq: LINK)
A Leading Global Sensors &
Printed Electronics Platform
November 2024
(Nasdaq: LINK) 1
FORWARD-LOOKING STATEMENTS
This presentation contains “forward-looking statements” within the meaning of the safe harbor provisions of the Private Securities Litigation Reform
Act of 1995. Forward-looking statements can be generally identified by phrases such as “thinks,” “anticipates,” “believes,” “estimates,” “expects,”
“intends,” “plans,” and similar words. Forward-looking statements include statements about our acquisition program, our projected annual revenue
run rate, and the effects of our recent acquisitions, including contributions to our products, manufacturing operations and the markets we serve.
Forward-looking statements are not guarantees of future performance and are inherently subject to uncertainties and other factors which could
cause actual results to differ materially from the forward-looking statement. These statements are based upon, among other things, assumptions
made by, and information currently available to, management, including management’s own knowledge and assessment of the company’s industry,
R&D initiatives, competition and capital requirements. Other factors and uncertainties that could affect the company’s forward-looking statements
include, among other things, the following: our success in predicting new markets and the acceptance of our new products; efficient management of
our infrastructure; the pace of technological developments and industry standards evolution and their effect on our target product and market
choices; the effect of outsourcing technology development; changes in the ordering patterns of our customers; a decrease in the quality and/or
reliability of our products; protection of our proprietary intellectual property; competition by alternative sophisticated as well as generic products;
continued availability of raw materials for our products at competitive prices; disruptions in our manufacturing facilities; risks of international sales
and operations including fluctuations in exchange rates; compliance with regulatory requirements applicable to our manufacturing operations; and
customer concentrations. Additional factors that could cause actual results to differ materially from those anticipated by our forward-looking
statements are under the captions “Risk Factors” and “Management’s Discussion and Analysis of Financial Condition and Results of Operations” in
our most recent Annual Report (Form 10-K) or Quarterly Report (Form 10-Q) filed with the Securities and Exchange Commission. Forward-looking
statements are made as of the date of this presentation, and we expressly disclaim any obligation to publicly update or revise any forward-looking
statements, whether as a result of new information, future events or otherwise.
(Nasdaq: LINK) © 2024 | All Rights Reserved | The information contained on these pages is confidential, intended only for selected recipients. It may not be used, published or redistributed without the prior written consent of Interlink Electronics, Inc. 2
INTRODUCTION: INTERLINK ELECTRONICS
WORLD-LEADING TRUSTED PROVIDER of sensors and printed
electronic solutions that support a wide range of applications, including
Human-Machine Interface (“HMI”) devices and IoT solutions, utilizing our
expertise in materials science, manufacturing, firmware and software to
produce in-house system solutions for custom specifications
PROVEN TRACK RECORD of supplying mission-critical technological
solutions in diverse markets including medical devices, automotive,
gas detection and environmental quality monitoring, oil and gas and
general industrial, and consumer electronics, providing standard and
custom-designed sensors that provide the flexibility and functionality
needed for today's sophisticated applications
AIMING TO BUILD A GLOBAL FULL-SERVICE PLATFORM
through large transformative deals and strategic tuck-in acquisitions of
companies at favorable prices that complement our vision and allow us to
enter new underserviced markets, while also broadening our offerings to
include engineered products and solutions
(Nasdaq: LINK) © 2024 | All Rights Reserved | The information contained on these pages is confidential, intended only for selected recipients. It may not be used, published or redistributed without the prior written consent of Interlink Electronics, Inc. 3
WHY INTERLINK? OUR 5-YEAR VISION FOR GROWTH
ACCELERATING GROWTH CURVE
• M&A
• Geographic expansion
• High ROIC incremental investments in sales and engineering capabilities
to boost organic growth
• Increasing market demand, from IoT to environmental concerns
• Expanded opportunities for cross-selling, engineered solutions and
product integration arising from M&A
• Highly experienced management and technical team
EXCITING FINANCIAL METRICS
• Revenue exceeding $100 million
• Gross margin over 50%
GREATER INSTITUTIONAL OWNERSHIP
• Buy-in to the Measurement Specialties roll-up model
• Increasing market cap validates momentum investment
(Nasdaq: LINK) © 2024 | All Rights Reserved | The information contained on these pages is confidential, intended only for selected recipients. It may not be used, published or redistributed without the prior written consent of Interlink Electronics, Inc. 4
WHY INTERLINK? OUR 5-YEAR VISION FOR GROWTH
(Continued)
COMPETITIVE ADVANTAGES
• Expertise in developing custom solutions in sensors and printed electronics
• Vertically integrated design, prototyping and manufacturing allows us to
provide value-added services to meet customer requirements (end-to-end
solutions)
• Large-volume, global Tier 1 OEM customers
• Global footprint including the United States, Europe, Singapore, China, and
Japan
• Growing standard product list with global distribution through platforms
such as DigiKey
• High-margin, uniquely engineered sensors and printed electronics
• High barriers to entry and high switching costs
(Nasdaq: LINK) © 2024 | All Rights Reserved | The information contained on these pages is confidential, intended only for selected recipients. It may not be used, published or redistributed without the prior written consent of Interlink Electronics, Inc. 5
POSITIONING FOR THE FUTURE
• Investment in expanding global sales force
• Additions to finance and M&A capabilities
• New personnel investments to support expected growth, both organic and M&A
• Sacrificing current EBITDA margins for future growth

LEADERSHIP
Steven N. Bronson Ryan J. Hoffman
CEO Chief Financial Officer
Steve has over 40 years of investment banking, Ryan joined Interlink as Chief Financial Officer in 2020
management, and entrepreneurial experience. He following 20 years of public accounting and professional
acquired control of Interlink in 2010 and returned it services experience at global public accounting firms,
to profitability. He now leads Interlink’s operations, including at 16 years at RSM (having served as an audit
M&A, and financing activities. Mr. Bronson has a partner) and 4 years at Ernst & Young. Ryan graduated
strong track record of executing public technology from Chapman University with a degree in accounting.
turnarounds, which led his first turnaround to a sale
of over 10x of his initial investment.
Declan Flannery Sreeni D. Rao, Ph.D., MBA
VP of Strategic Alliances VP of Product Management
Declan has over 30 years of experience in Sreeni has over 25 years of product innovation,
technical and operational roles in global printed operational and global business leadership experience in
electronics companies. He has been a key sensors and semiconductors with startups as well as
member of the management team since 2006 and premier technology companies such as TDK, Analog
has supported Interlink’s international expansion. Devices, Texas Instruments and IBM. He has a PhD in
Declan graduated from Manchester Metropolitan Electrical and Computer Engineering from UC Irvine and
University with a degree in Chemistry and holds a an Executive MBA from Northeastern University.
diploma in Management from the Open University.
